comment: This course shouldn't have been difficult but his 3 different grading schemes and use of constant busy work like the check ins bogged down the actual work. He also seemed to take joy in the fact the class test averages were in the 60s. For those that don't like busy work and group work do NOT take this course. I didn't even finish this course.

This class made me question my self worth lol. Overall he's kind of rude and all our exam averages were like 60s but his grading schemes make it so that even if you fail you could still pass the class. SI sessions are more helpful than he is. Also prayers

The TA i had for lab was super kind and an amazing teacher. I have not heard anything good about Dovid from people I have talked to. I'd say only gamble when it comes to lab because you will prob get a good TA, But avoid Kozlovsky.

Didn't get the professor, I got one of his (MANY) TA's that was teaching BIO1108L. And our TA was AWESOME. The class sometimes ran long because the TA overexplained, but I'd rather than then underexplain. He was super funny and helpful, and he always prepared us for the labs. Take this class, 50%, you'll end up with an amazing TA.

He is lecture heavy and the TA's are better at explaining concepts than he is. During lectures, he tends to talk down to students and is rude via email. I would not take him again, he made me feel stupid for struggling with the material, and has no lenience with students in any capacity.

Honestly, do not take this professor's class unless you absolutely have to. You are expected to teach yourself the material and do the homework before class, and then come in and listen to his boring lecture and do group assignments. The exams are complicatedly worded, and are based on how well you have taught yourself the material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: He teaches for Bio majors, it's not supposed to be super easy. He wants to make sure you can apply your knowledge and gives lots of opportunities for you to ask questions. If you pay attention, ask questions as needed, and do all the work you'll be fine. If you sleep through class and don't do the homework don't expect to pass. He's super nice too.

Ungodly.  He makes all of his own labs/assignments and it is excruciating to read through them as they are unstructured, chaotic and not standardized. My father is a bio professor at another university, and he said that this professor is intentionally aiming for students to not do well on assignments.  The wording is very tricky.

Let's be honest; Dr. K's class is good. I believe those who got a B or lower do not deserve to leave a bad comment on him. Everything on the exam comes from the lecture slides. You are allowed to bring a small note during the exam. Even if you ruin your exam, he has three grading schemes, and one of them is participation-heavy. "Difficult to fail."

Be prepared for a challenging class. The professor is a tough grader, and the PowerPoints often don't match the material on the tests, which makes studying frustrating. Success in this class depends on completing Learning Catalytics and Mastering assignments. Overall, not the best experience.

I honestly liked Dr. K's class :) It was hard because the tests were conceptual and required you to apply the information you learned + interpret graphs/math. Attending lectures is important! He adds on to the ppt to help you better understand and you get participation points towards your grade. There's group work but all bio II classes have them.

The tests never matched the quizzes or the homework. For example I was calculating the surface area of a cylinder while in the unit for Fungi??? He is very knowledgeable about the topic, but condescending towards you if you don't. 4 tests including the final and participation points you can only get in class.
Do not study the PowerPoints. Use the learning catalytics. Very boring lectures but you have to attend. Know how to study and you will do well.

Contrary to some reviews, this professor is very fair and honestly his use of using three grading schemes to give you the best grade makes it easy to get an A. This class does require some effort so its important to just pay attention and you'll be alright.

As mentioned in other reviews, the tests are VERY real-world focused whilst the lectures really aren't. There's some helpful info in the lectures like with the mastering assignments, but you're better off using the straight textbook and other side resources for the tests. Tests themselves are pretty difficult, rest of class isn't too bad though

The test were honestly kinda hard and I didn't feel like it was covered in lecture but I didn't study as much as I should have. He gives a lot of opportunities to get the grade you want. He does different grading scales and chooses the best grade from it, opportunity to earn points back from your final exam over different units.

Just no. He teaches as if we already know what he's talking about, and majority of what he teaches you have to take it and apply it to the real world because I promise that's all the test is. He's also a tough grader on the group assignments. Also, there are more tests than time for you to even understand whats on the test.

He ends every statement by going up in pitch as if it's a question (trust me this will get annoying). He is condescending. He goes really slow so lectures are ofc very boring. Tests are much harder than lecture content. Participation counts. The homework is difficult, time-consuming, and due on random dates that he never reminds you of. Do not rec.

Professor is a nice guy but this class is very difficult. I took the asynchronous summer class and it felt like so much busy work. There was a quiz basically everyday on top of reading multiple chapter and mastering assignments. You technically had until July 14th to get everything done except a few "hard deadlines." Tests are HARD!!

I've been through an entire electrical engineering degree and his class was by far the most effort I have ever put into a class, nevertheless a lab. I don't think ive ever had a peer review draft graded as if it was a final paper before, but there's a first for everything.

This class was very difficult. Tests are SO HARD for no reason and questions are always conceptual rather that memorization, so you have to really understand everything. Dr K. is very accessible outside of class. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS!!! He always answers emails as well. If you really put in the effort and get help, you will do fine in the class.

As a biology major I am currently doing the worst in terms of grades in his class. Dr. K's lectures are boring, the power points never help, the tests are really hard, and theres a lot of homework. Not to mention the tough grading on group assignments despite it being "for completeness." Save yourself the trouble.

I was looking forward to this class but Mr. Kozlovsky made me hate it. He shows insane favoritism in his classes and does not do well with confrontation or any ideas that he did not come up with. He was very rude and almost petty outside of class through email and would forget that we had previously spoke about.

this is a class that was definitely my style. challenged me, but was not impossible, which i liked. we unfortunately have to use R, a coding software throughout, though--but he guides you through most of the steps.
he's really nice and as long as you try and communicate then you will pass. also he's very helpful in his office hours.

very accessible out of class and answers emails fast. I will say unfortunately if you do have a personal emergency he is not very lenient and can be insensitive to it. You won't have a lot of time to make up the work or might not get a grade for it a all. if you have group work do not do the work by yourself because he will give you a 0.

take anyone else. his lectures are essentially worthless when it comes time for an exam. he says so much but so little at the same time. the class exam averages are always low and he acts as if he has no fault in that. take anyone else
Just plain awful man. Take anyone else.

Dr. K really is a great professor. He thoroughly explains things and provides clear expectations on groups projects. That being said, he is a very tough grader when it comes to said projects. For exams you get one notecard cheat sheet, which honestly is not that helpful. Best advice I can give is study his lecture power points well!

He lectured, but only half of what he taught prepared us for the test. Everything else had to be learned on your own from the textbook. I would not recommend his class if you have to option of anyone else.

This is a regular biology class and lectures with Dr. Kozlovsky were boring but the tests were from his powerpoints, quizzes, and stuff he would mention in lecture. He gives some bonus and the final was not too hard. You do have to put in the work to understand the content but once you do, it should not be too bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: The test has nothing to do with the lectures and is very hard. The SI is helpful when it comes to the group project but he is not. The quizzes are hard and participation is mandatory.He also expects you to know stuff that he did not go over in class.

This is a hard class- it is a weed-out class. Redemption points on the final, full page cheat sheet on final and notecard for each test. Required groupwork and attendance grade. Content wise YOU HAVE TO READ THE TEXTBOOK - the lecture covers half the content on the test and the textbook covers the other half, if you put in the work you will do fine
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Great teacher. He really cares about the content and you understanding it. Ask questions. He has office hours aswell. Very understanding as long as he knows you!

Prof K was an amazing teacher. I was doing very poorly in his class and reached out. He was able to help me raise my test scores drastically with different techniques to overcome test anxiety. He mostly has 2 homework ass. per week, & tests are easy if you study and listen in class (allowed a cheat sheet). Attendance is mandatory!!

As long as you show up to lectures you should be fine. He is really nice. Although he is test heavy, he allowed us a one page cheat sheet for the exams which helped. Just have to go out of your way to make sure you know what your'e supposed to. One thing that I didn't like is he does like giving out group assignments.
very knowledgeable but not a very good professor. just staay away if possible
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: OK look... Bio 2 is a hard subject, and he's required to cover a lot of material. Take him, show up to class, take notes, review, and take all the quizzes and learning catalytic and you'll be perfectly fine. He's funny, caring, and grades beyond fair. Do your best effort and he notices and rewards it.

Don't listen to the other people, they are the petty ones who didn't pay attention, didn't read the syllabus, or didn't read the GRADING RUBRIC... Dr K is awesome, and it is VERY easy to get a good grade. He's extremely lenient on grading. He doesn't put up with attitudes, half-ass submissions, or people who don't come to class. Just pay attention

Do not take him ! The lab assignments are fairly decent but he grades ridiculously petty. He takes off points for the SMALLEST things. And shows favoritism. Stay away from this class by any means. Hes not worth the headache because youll definitely have one at the end of semester .

Prof. K is pretty good. He tells you exactly what to do for everything, so make sure you're listening. The hardest thing this semester was the ecology manuscript, so ask him as many questions as you have. He can be kind of scary to ask questions to, but he's pretty good as a professor overall. He's not that strict on grading the labs either.

Personally Bio has been hard for me in general, I would say this professor is okay. Not the best but also not the worse. I LITERALLY got 100% on all of my classwork assignments/homeworks/quizzes, but when it came to exams I failed all of them below 50% BUT I still passed with a C. complete your assignments on time & actually study, & you'll be fine

I usually dont give bad ratings on the Kennesaw professors cause I actually do enjoy them, but this one in particular was the worst professor Ive ever taken in my life. I feel like there was a lot of systematic racism going on within the class and his grading take my advice if you are a POC dont take his class:/

If you are wanting an easy A for biology 1108 this is NOT the class for you. I enjoyed his class and he his very kind and passionate about his students and biology, but his exams are hard. He grades attendance! He gives you plenty of extra credit opportunities so do them and Attend his study hours and review past exams, it will help you a lot!

I loved his class! Participation matters because we have live questions to answer during the lecture (completion not accuracy) so make sure you attend. Group assignments assigned every week and due the following week, but he grades harshly on those so be wary. Exams and quizzes are OPEN NOTE! A lot of extra credit opportunities too.

He's a really tough professor grading-wise. Like others, I was lulled in by his good ratings, but in BIO 2 Lab, he isn't enjoyable. If you take him, be prepared to get points off on very small things.

Honestly, he is just not that great. His lectures don't help our class average on tests were barely ever passing. Group work is just bad especially because he pairs you and doesn't help when the group is terrible. He is also kind of condescending and rude in emails and makes you feel dumb. I honestly wanna change majors bc of him. Do not take!

TAKE HIS CLASS! Super easy to pass. Lectures have live questions that you need to answer, so prepare to go to class (completion not accuracy). His lectures just go over the powerpoints that he posts online. Allowed to use written notes on our quizzes and exams, which helped a lot. Final was not cumulative. Only con is group work.

He is so sweet, and a great teacher. Offers any type of help and will always work with you. His tests are hard but he doest surprise you the questions come all from his lectures. He makes his own tests. I got a 94 in this class and I didn't put more than 10 hours into this class studying all semester. ALL TESTS AND QUIZES ARE OPEN NOTES! take him

AVOID if you can. The professor is very nice and funny but the tests are absolutely impossible. The tests are open notes but none of the notes we take in class help one bit on the tests. He makes this class hard for NO reason. I have always done great in science classes but this class actually made me miserable. Also he gives impossible group work
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: Beware if you take this professor. Everything is super hard from the exams to even group projects. The quizzes and exams are open notes but you spend so much time looking for the answers the test is over by then. His lectures are super fast and attendance is mandatory. Homework is probably the easiest because answers are online but do not take him

If you have a chance to take another professor please DO NOT PICK HIM ! This class could be very easy but he makes it so complicated. Every test and quiz is full of word vomit sentences that make no sense. Everything is lockdown browser and webcam and open notes but trust me the open notes never work. Group projects and quizzes every week. AVOID !
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: DO NOT TAKE HIM! our class average is always failing. He makes his tests extremely difficult to where no one knows how to study for them. Theres weekly hw which is easy, and a quiz or a test weekly. Do not take him if you want a good GPA. I excel in science classes and I am struggling in his while doing everything he said to do to pass.

Dovid is a nice guy but as a professor, I would not take him. His tests are by far some of the hardest even with the open notes options. There are quizzes every week and a test every other week. I studied this course more than I did my major classes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr. K was super informative about how to do every lab assignment. He would always make sure we had enough info to do what was required of us. Especially for writing manuscripts, he explained everythign super well, though he did grade those pretty harshly the first time around. Everything else is pretty universal across all labs. Take him for lab!

Dr. K is super chill and is willing to help you in any way possible. If he sees that you're trying and putting in effort, he will do his best to help you. The tests and quizzes are difficult, especially the ones for the first 3 units 4 units total. Reading the textbook helps quite a bit but a lot of his material is staright from the lectures.

The homework is really easy so thats a plus. But his quizzes and tests were hard. Luckily he does do lots of extra credit and lets you take exams 2 times. He is really caring and sweet as a person! Take advantage of the EC frfr. Also read the book because thats all his tests are don't even look at the powerpoints.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Kozlovsky is very sweet and caring. Though his text and quizzes are pretty hard. But he does give a good amount of extra credit and give 2 attempts on exams. Despite that its a pretty hard class but reading the book helps a lot. Overall, I really like the professor but the class was super hard. Plus so much info for a summer class.

Very good teacher and cares a lot about his students. He provides very good feedback and emails quickly as well. Despite all this, this class (Biology 2 Lab) is really difficult. I barely slipped out with an A as he is one of the most pickiest graders I have ever had. If you want to get an A in his class, I recommend scheduling office hours a lot

Yall, this professor is a person that actually cares about his students. He wants everyone to pass and gives multiple chances at doing well in the course. It was plain and simple, participate and get your participation pts, do your homework, and make sure to review what he says during lectures. Yes he does fill in the blank but only 5 of them are.

I took him for both lab and lecture, worst two classes of my life. He is a tough and picky grader. I followed everything on his rubric and even his comments from pervious assignments and still never even made a B. His tests are also hard because it consists pf multiple choice and FILL IN THE BLANKS. He gives extra credit, but he grades those harsh
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: He is a tough grader I took him for lab if you want to make sure your assignments are correct to get a high grade contact him he is sweet and caring just tough on grading and he is clear with instructions.
I took him for lab. He was always clear what he wanted in the assignments and gave about 2 weeks for each.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Not a difficult class. His class is very test heavy (participation, 4 tests including final, and Mastering HW). The tests are open written note. They weren't all memorization (mostly application) but they still helped. He really wants his students to pass and was always available to answer questions.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy
